alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Patrick; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Pittsylvania, southeastern Carroll, Henry and Patrick Counties, the City of Danville and the City of Martinsville through 400 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered thunderstorms along the Highway 58 corridor from Hillsville to Danville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rain and lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may flood ditches and wash debris onto the highway. Lightning may knock out the power and pose a threat to outdoor activities. Locations impacted include... Danville... Martinsville... Hillsville... Stuart... Axton... Fancy Gap... and Ararat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with some of these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle until the storms have passed.
